website_summaries.verdict: An outstanding assortment of teas by a company that's been selecting teas world-wide since the 1880s. The best variety, quality, and value for the price.
pros: Offers an impressive assortment of flavorful teas – 8 varieties and 48 tea bags
Tea connoisseurs rave about the unique flavors including Lemon & Orange, Black Tea, and Ceylon Breakfast
cons: Some of the flavors are stronger than others, and the tea bags aren't individually packaged

customer_reviews.title: Unimpressed!
customer_reviews.text: nothing particulary special about this chamomile tea from Taylors. very bland to my taste. I've enjoyed more the chamomile teas from Eastern europe, they include actual chamomile flowers in their bags, unlike the chamomile dust in these. A lovely chamomile tea should be fragrant, flowery, a pleasure for both smell and taste, this tea has none of those things. Also quality control seems to be an issue at Taylors.... I had one bag spray chamomile dust all over me when I opened the envelope and I've had a few bags open while in the cup, making a less than pleasant cup of tea. have to say, nothing special here, keep looking.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Superior Tea for a Good Price
customer_reviews.text: The chamomile tea is so good that my dad, who is not a tea drinker, steals a few off of me every time he visits. I drink a cup of this every night before I go to bed. I sometimes pair it with a little honey, lavender, milk or all three if I'm feeling fancy! You cannot get better quality tea for the price! I've also had the orange lemon, the breakfast blend and the Assam. All equally fantastic. Also wanted to share my punny mug with you all (:
customer_reviews.author: Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Not so good
customer_reviews.text: Im very sorry but this wasnt the same tea i ordered before. The first teas i ordered had tons of flavor and you coukd smell it as it brewed. This is packaged differently from box to the tea bag it self. I may have made a mistake on my ordering but this tea had no berry flavors. I can drink the different flavors and not notice a difference. Sorry i had wrting bad reviews but i dont like it. I would send it back but ive done thrown out the box and dumped the tea bags in my bowl
customer_reviews.author: Learningthebiblethroughsharing

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and not the best
customer_reviews.text: The teas are okay, I wouldn’t recommend this brand though. Would probably purchase some flavors individually because of the pros. Best/strongest flavor, not bitter: - earl grey - decaf and regular English breakfast - lemon and orange Worst flavor: - peppermint (weak, hardly any peppermint notes) - chamomile (tastes like dust) I haven’t tried the Assam tea, sorry! Pros: - cheap - some of the teas taste okay - not too bitter if steeped too long Cons: - teabag design; if you pull the string too hard/fast, you can rip a hole in the mesh, and if you tear the outer packaging the wrong way you will rip a hole in the mesh - weak flavor on chamomile and peppermint
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: Little flavor
customer_reviews.text: I am a huge tea drinker and have had several Taylor's of Harrogate teas, but this is by-far, is my least favorite. There is a hint of spice that is almost undetectable and the tea is very mild. I was hoping for a more bold flavor that would drive home that "Christmas flavor" that other Christmas teas manage well. It was worth a shot, but I won't be buying this again.
customer_reviews.author: Chewy

customer_reviews.title: Very BIG difference between the box of 20 individually foil ...
customer_reviews.text: Very BIG difference between the box of 20 individually foil wrapped tea bags and the box of 50 teabags that aren't individually wrapped. It's two different tasting teas. The 20 individually wrapped tea bags have a metallic flavor with a bitter aftertaste. It's also a rather weak tea. I was dissatisfied and unpleasantly surprised.
customer_reviews.author: great app. I have shared with friends

customer_reviews.title: I will never purchase from this seller again
customer_reviews.text: This seller does not except returns and my very large box of tea which was to be used for the presentation of the teabags in a bed-and-breakfast was crushed and is unusable I tried to do an exchange or return and it is impossible to do so I recommend never to purchase from this seller again
customer_reviews.author: Joy The Toy Lover

customer_reviews.title: lives up to it's name :  great  "afternoon"  tea
customer_reviews.text: l have been drinking this flavor of Taylors of Harrogate for a few years and I enjoy it as an afternoon..or even sometimes evening..tea. A good (second flush) Darjeeling tea will have a subtle muscatel (wine-like) flavor and I feel this brand of tea consistently delivers on that expectation . For quite some time, I was purchasing the smaller 20 count boxes but , over time, that really adds up in shipping fees , so I finally just ordered the big box . I would definitely recommend this tea to others...(people are always welcome to seek out the 20 count box if they have not tried a second flush Darjeeling tea before).
customer_reviews.author: Joe Cool

customer_reviews.title: Even if you tear the bag at the pre-sliced corner you run a fairly good chance of tearing into the bag
customer_reviews.text: I was very impressed by the taste of this tea and I would definitely order it again. There is one problem... I have experienced that with the tea bag itself it rests very close to the top of the bag. Even if you tear the bag at the pre-sliced corner you run a fairly good chance of tearing into the bag. I ruined two bags when I tore where instructed. Be careful when opening the bags because this tea is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Dorman

customer_reviews.title: Flavor is nasty
customer_reviews.text: This flavor tastes like sour apple battery acid. Our guests were not pleased with the flavor or taste. We threw the box in the trash. CHANGE THE SOUR TO SWEET.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly bold and good
customer_reviews.text: Was not sure when I first order this tea... I already knew that it was not going to be in a individual wrap so that didn't bother me as much as other complains. I usually get assam from this brand, for the price the tea is bold and strong. However, I was quite surprised with Scottish Breakfast, actually became my favorite over Assam.. If youre okay with simple tea this is great. Looking for fancier, this is not your cup of tea. Only thing that I had a huge problem with is the way how it was delivered. package was completely crushed. Hope they take care of the way they sent out packages.
customer_reviews.author: Isabellee

customer_reviews.title: Poor alternative to Taylor's much better decaf Yorkshire Tea
customer_reviews.text: Funny that they don't sell the Decaf Yorkshire Tea on here, but they sell this Decaf breakfast blend for 6x the price! Taylors has a branded Amazon store, which carries all their teas except their wonderful Decaf Yorkshire Tea. This meek decaf breakfast blend is a very poor "alternative" if you like or have heard of the wonderful decaf Yorkshire. The fancy tea bags have very little actual tea in them. The resultant brew is okay but a sorry cuppa compared to their "standard" decaf. Why does America still get the short end of the stick when it comes to tea?
customer_reviews.author: B_T_B

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend this set of tea selections from the Taylors of Harrogate @ unbeatable pricing!
customer_reviews.text: I am a huge fan of Taylors of Harrogate's Yorkshire Gold tea.... This variety selection of their teas is particularly commendable as I had never tried for instance their lemon & orange tea before.... I am definitely looking forward to ordering a few of these selections once I run out. Lastly, if you have never tried Taylors of Harrogate before, this pack maybe a very good way to try their amazing tea offerings!
customer_reviews.author: purplehaze

customer_reviews.title: SO glad i came to know taylors of Harrogate. Very excellent. the real thing all the way!
customer_reviews.text: wow! Very high quality and the package is absolutely gift worthy. I am really enjoying this assortment. its funny... being a native long islander (NY) many of these teas just aren't popular here and are never mentioned. I found myself doing a internet search for "what is Assam tea?" was a little nervous about trying that one. i really feel like i am in on something now that I have tried this brand. sort of like going to England with out actually going! I wish they carried this brand in my local super market. o well. hey....Cheerio! A good time to cue up some Tull...
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT EXPERIENCE--WONDERFUL TEAS!!!
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful set of fragrant and tasty teas! Extremely pleased with the many different samples and the numbers of each sample contained in the set. Really gives you an exciting introduction into the many different classic teas available through Taylors of Harrogate, and makes the teas you purchase off the shelves in supermarkets taste odd and indifferent. I'll be returning to Taylors for my Chamomile! The company from whom I purchased this variety box shipped the item in record time and without incident. It arrived in perfect shape, and I would definitely recommend them to anyone ordering in future. A five-star seller!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Not A Fan...Yet
customer_reviews.text: I am a die-hard Harney & Sons fan. This is the first time I've tried Taylor's of Harrogate. The packaging is beautiful. Very classy. I won't say I hate the tea but this white tea is clearly an acquired taste that I have not yet acquired. The first sip literally reminded me of wonton soup in a Chinese restaurant. I love wonton soup but not in my tea :) I'm not giving up on Taylor's of Harrogate yet. I'm just hoping they have another white tea I can try because I will not buy this one again.
customer_reviews.author: Mother Of Unicorns

customer_reviews.title: Not too orange, not too lemon
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a different flavor to try out, I've been getting tired of my Lady Gray, so I ended up buying the Taylors sample pack to try some different things out and this was the winner. It's got orange, it's got lemon, and neither one of them are bitter and it's well balanced. I had to go back and buy the 100 pack because the 20 pack was out. Yes, I know such suffering! Worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Afura

customer_reviews.title: Great Introduction to Taylors of HarrogateTeas
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed with Taylors of Harrogate Teas. The citrus of the "Lemon & Orange Tea" complemented the black tea flavor instead of overpowering it. The sampler pack introduced me to "Assam Tea". Described as 'strong and malty', it also has a very subtle chocolate sweetness; with a great color and aroma, it is a terrific afternoon tea. The "English Breakfast" and "Earl Grey" are (thankfully) no surprise and better than most brands I recall.
customer_reviews.author: PinkieWasHere

customer_reviews.title: ... all of the items I bought from AMAZON were PERFECT!!
customer_reviews.text: I was in charge of the beverages at a going-away party and all of the items I bought from AMAZON were PERFECT!!! The tea, the coffeemaker, the electric kettle - EVERYTHING was perfect for my job as the "beverage" person. I set up my table in the corner and offered tea, coffee, hot chocolate and water, different sugars, different creamers, the "stock your home plastic spoons" were also a hit to the guests. I purchased everything at AMAZON and everyone absolutely loved it!!!!! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Princess 47

customer_reviews.title: Darjeeling or dishwater?
customer_reviews.text: While I usually don't like to complain; I will this time. I am a tea drinker by heritage - great-grandparents emigrated from England and we have always had the kettle on (especially when someone is upset). I was really looking forward to trying the Taylor Afternoon Darjeeling, but was very disappointed. Just as the headline says, I didn't know if I was drinking Darjeeling or dishwater and it didn't improve. Fortunately, I only bought a twenty pack to try it out so it was not a great loss.
customer_reviews.author: Bob W

customer_reviews.title: Best for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Let's just say that I know my chamomile tea, and this one is by far one of the best for the price. It's helped me transition away from caffeinated drinks, and helped suppress my acid reflux. The only issue I have now is that I prob am drinking too much of it, but it is just so smooth. I can even use the same bag for 2 cups.
customer_reviews.author: Ina

customer_reviews.title: Where's The Jasmine???
customer_reviews.text: Despite the several positive reviews, I found this supposedly boutique Taylor's Jasmine tea to be bland and tasteless. Having lived and traveled throughout Asia much of my life, I have had many fine Jasmine teas -- in loose, pearl and bag form. From my experience, I found nothing Jasmine about this tea. Sadly, Taylor's neither smells or tastes of Jasmine. It is not even very good quality green tea (and the 3rd-party seller will not accept returns). For a genuine Jasmine tea experience, you might try Yamamotoyama or Solimo (on Amazon) or Uncle Lee's (check online). Much better teas at much better prices.
customer_reviews.author: Doctor A.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Great selection, fantastic flavors and to be honest with you the best orange lemon tea I have ever had in my life! Other flavors are just all above 10 stars. Do not even hesitate to give it a try coz you'll love it. The only thing I wish was better was the box to keep everything more together. This tea deserves Gold box! It's that good and unique. Great seller, got the package a day after I ordered it clean and beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: Bella

customer_reviews.title: Nice packaging, mild flavor
customer_reviews.text: This tea is packaged well. Each bag has a string and a tag, and is located inside another paper wrapper. Flavor-wise, it's plain and mild. If you just want plain white tea, this is it. White tea is often described as healthier than green or black tea. It requires water that isn't quite boiling hot--around 170 F or so. Although the box recommends boiling and then letting the water cool, it's often better to heat water to 170 F and then infuse without letting the water boil. This improves the tea's flavor. Just make sure your water's clean.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: My taste buds were sad, but others rejoiced
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t get to drink any of these. Because I cannot have caffeine & I wasn’t paying attention & thought these were decafe. Sadly, no. However, I do know they are amazing from back when I could drink caffeine & because my mum took all of the boxes to work & handed them out sparingly & when they were gone, everyone was sad they had to go back to the office tea. They frequently hope I order wrong again. It’s a great deal, too.
customer_reviews.author: The Lampades

customer_reviews.title: Bow to me
customer_reviews.text: This is truly amazing tea with some exotic flavors which makes you feel like you are truly from a Nobel family in England, once I sipped some of it and I ended up as Joshua duke of York, True story
customer_reviews.author: Omar Al Maani

customer_reviews.title: Best tea ever!
customer_reviews.text: OMG YUM!!! I thought it was just going to be a couple of new flavors along with old favorites, but WOW. The flavors POP. Even on the English breakfast tea and Earl Grey teas..it was a new experience! It's almost like all the tea I have consumed in my entire life was stale or sub-par. My usual brand is Stash tea, which is really good...but this tea is truly exceptional! The mint is my new favorite.
customer_reviews.author: sharon surface

customer_reviews.title: I always get a smashed box of tea
customer_reviews.text: This is a tea I love. Amazon always sends it in an envelope not a box so it looks as if it was steam rolled over. While it doesn't affect the taste I do need to put the tea in another container once I get it since box is destroyed. With subscribe and save why not ship with the rest of the boxed order? I could see if I was buying it alone send it the cheapest method. I have bought it 11 times with subscribe and save and 11 smashed boxes in an envelope while canned and other boxed goods in order come a day or two before or after in a shipping box.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn M.

customer_reviews.title: This tea has no flavor
customer_reviews.text: This product has no flavor. I normally drink the Taylor's Scottish Breakfast which isn't as strong as I like still has a pleasant flavor. This tea has no flavor. Two tea bags and steeped for 20 minutes and no flavor!
customer_reviews.author: J. Leggio

customer_reviews.title: Good variety, fair price, decent tea.
customer_reviews.text: I like tea. Originally purchased to drink at work, but haven't brought it in yet. Had several cups, they're all good. Peppermint was nice, chamomile was OK (not a fan of just straight chamomile, but went nicely with a little lemon & honey). Assam was huge, Lemon and Orange was decent, and decaf breakfast tea was good. Haven't gotten to the Earl Grey or regular English Breakfast yet, but I can count on those being alright. Came in a rather nice, compartmentalized cardboard box. 48 teabags for 12 bucks was a fair price, considering my local market.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Dinsmore

customer_reviews.title: The finest tea you can buy.
customer_reviews.text: I heard from a certain YouTube commentator from the Uk that this was the favorite tea in the UK and naturally I thought, "it must be really good then." and indeed it is, every flavor in the variety pack is delicious, my personal favorite is the Green Tea with Jasmine. If you enjoy a good tea that isn't shy about its flavor, this is it.
customer_reviews.author: John A. LoGiudice

customer_reviews.title: What are you waiting for
customer_reviews.text: This is actually my 3rd box. I got it as a gift then ended up with my mom's box when she didn't use it. Now, I finally bought my own. I absolutely love them. I admit I don't like the Assam flavor very much but I use it for when I cook Indian food instead to add flavor. I love all the other flavors. Even my toddler is getting in on the tea game already. He loves drinking some of the tea with me. I highly recommend this variety pack of tea. It's packaging is made of nice cardboard and it's actually pretty. I don't keep them in the box. It makes a very nice present.
customer_reviews.author: Dora

customer_reviews.title: good quality jasmine tea
customer_reviews.text: I tried other jasmine green teas and this one is best of all, I feel because I could tell the Jasmine is quality herb and is essential to calming and relaxing anxiety. some other kinds have a higher green tea and you barely sense the Jasmine so if your a Jasmine tea enthusiast or just a beginner try for sure you will enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: lori reyes

customer_reviews.title: Personal Issues Digesting It
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a citrus tea that was cheaper than Twinnings Lady Grey and found this. However, this tea reliably gives me a stomach ache. This doesn't happen with any other tea or coffee for me and it's happened at least 5 times before I was sure enough to pin it on the tea and write this review. Maybe it's me, maybe it's because it was delivered in 95 degree weather, maybe it's something else. Other than that major issue, it tastes great and is affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: 2 thumbs (and a pinky) up!
customer_reviews.text: The variety pack is great! Teas really do taste so good and each bag can be used multiple times. I use a big mug and leave the bag in the cup. I've refilled with hot water twice, for a total of 3 mugfuls and still get pretty strong tea. Really happy with this collection!
customer_reviews.author: G Vandamm

customer_reviews.title: Weirdly bubblegummy
customer_reviews.text: I wanted very much to like this green tea with mint, as I have liked other brands’ green tea with mint. But I felt this had too much of an odd bubblegum flavor to it to be enjoyable. And I don’t mean mint gum - I mean it tasted like Dubble Bubble, that cheap sugary pink gum that comes in individually wrapped rocks. Very odd. Still a fan of other Taylor’s of Harrogate teas (which is why I took a chance on this one!) but not this. Never again this.
customer_reviews.author: Lissa Angeline

customer_reviews.title: Nice!!!
customer_reviews.text: This tea box is very nice. You get quite a lot of flavor from the teabags. So far I’ve tried the lemon orange one and it is sooo good and soothing. I was planning on keeping the teabags in the box itself, had it not been for the delivery people most likely getting lazy and just throwing the box around, because it was completely Destroyed when I opened it, but its not the sellers fault at all, just wanted to mention it. Very good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Janny

customer_reviews.title: Produces a calming and refreshing cup of tea
customer_reviews.text: I tried chamomile tea one time in a different brand and did not care for it. This popped up as a suggested product in my account, and I decided to give it a try. I love the taste. It is calming and refreshing. The quality of the bags is also great. It is also great for putting in a spray bottle for a refreshing facial toner or for spraying on your hair for added shine and overall conditioning. I am definitely hooked and will be a returning customer.
customer_reviews.author: jennann

customer_reviews.title: Nice tea set
customer_reviews.text: I can't comment to flavor - I don't drink tea, I bought this because I provide tea and coffee for my AirBnB guests and wanted a selection of tea that had a box so I didn't need to buy a separate one. I was a little disappointed in this box to be honest, it looked a lot sturdier in the pictures than it actually is. It's basically just a regular box only separated into sections for each flavor. Still looks nice, and I'm sure the flavors will be good.
customer_reviews.author: rbittman

customer_reviews.title: Comes better than advertised!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tea set as a gift for my boyfriend's mother, as she enjoys teas very often. I've had the opportunity to try the tea myself, and it is authentic and rich. The box indicates that the tea comes from North Yorkshire, England. I would definitely buy this tea set again, comes with descriptions on the inside of the box, each type of tea organized beautifully. There is even a couple of options for caffeine-free drinks! I'll be a returning customer for sure, only wanted to spread the knowledge with a small review. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Gabrielle Weaver

customer_reviews.title: Very weak
customer_reviews.text: My Mum’s a Brit, she gave us tea in our baby bottles, no joke. So I’ve had tea time every morning and afternoon for as long as I can remember. I don’t use the tea pot anymore since it’s just for me, but I do make a large cup of it. I have to use 2 tea bags and steep for far longer than usual to flavor out of these bags. I guess it was worth a try, but not buying them again. Still on the hunt for a good and strong decaf tea.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper 402

customer_reviews.title: Have only tried one tea
customer_reviews.text: I've only tried one of the 48 count, but what I've tried is absolutely delicious. Very nice variety of teas, and very eye appealing presentation of the assorted teas. I decided to try the Lemon Orange first, and am so happy I did, such a great flavor. I actually regret adding honey before tasting, and will not make that mistake with my next cup.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Classic British Tea
customer_reviews.text: I’m a regular tea drinker, so when I bumped into this offer I was only too happy to try it out. It turns out that each type of tea is delicious, definitely getting some more of this brand in the future. I really like that they included the decaffeinated variety in the pack. This would also make a good choice for a gift.
customer_reviews.author: Trading Robot

customer_reviews.title: Great for Expats and Tea Lovers!
customer_reviews.text: I am a Brit living in the USA and I miss tea from home so much. I was super happy when I found these as they are a taste of home. The presentation box was great and I actually leave them in there and just use them from the box as they look so smart. I will be ordering more for myself and as gifts for friends. The product is fresh and has a variety of amazing flavours. Perfect for any tea lover!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Bradley

customer_reviews.title: It's ok
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't get their English breakfast tea again. It's lacking in flavor and richness. It's only slightly better than the boring American Lipton tea. The package box was completely smashed like a pancake during delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bitter with an unappetizing  color
customer_reviews.text: I love Taylor’s English Bkfst teabags but tried this Darjeeling instead. I just can’t seem to like it due to taste (bitter, Not to be confused with strong). The color is off-putting - a greyish taupe . I tried brewing it different amounts of time... no difference. Just can’t drink even a cup of it...perhaps that’s the nature of Darjeeling, but I remember it being smooth and more mild than this brand’s. Love their other teas so gave 2 stars instead of 1
customer_reviews.author: ruthie

customer_reviews.title: Will be ordering again!
customer_reviews.text: The packaging is really lovely. It closes well and it gives you a good choice of teas to sample before purchasing an entire tin. Taylor's is well established and has an impeccable reputation. As a Tea Blogger and Reviewer, it is one of the best ones out there and I have tasted pretty much all of there teas. It also made a lovely Mother's Day gift and you can't beat the price!
customer_reviews.author: Pirate Patty Reviews

customer_reviews.title: smooth green tea with mint
customer_reviews.text: I like my green tea with a little flavor when I'm drinking this at work, and this is perfect - it's individually bagged, so I can throw it in a drawer or carry it around to meetings then have it whenever, and that also keeps it nice and fresh. The tea itself is smooth and tasteful with just a bit of mint, nothing too overpowering. It's a good quality of green tea.
customer_reviews.author: nekojita

customer_reviews.title: Terrific Tea Discovery
customer_reviews.text: For years we have had a favorite tea--Darjeeling by Twining. Now, with Taylor's "Afternoon Darjeeling," we have two favorite teas. Love the new discovery. Who knew there was another classic British tea company offering a Darjeeling tea? Now, we do. You should try Taylors if you are a fan of the Himalayan foothills and Darjeeling tea . . . afternoons are good!
customer_reviews.author: Pelican Pointe

customer_reviews.title: Made for a hotel dining buffet?
customer_reviews.text: I like this brand of English breakfast tea--nice full flavor, rich and refreshing. These bags are in individual packets, as if one was grabbing them from the coffee bar at a hotel. No complaints except its a bit wasteful style of packaging for at home. But, if you do not use these everyday, they are likely to stay fresh longer. Good price and only Amazon option for a big box.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: MY NEW FAVORITE
customer_reviews.text: This tea is absolutely delicious. There aren't very many teas I can drink without sugar or honey.... but this is one of them. This tea is very light and crisp. It's similar to English breakfast tea but a LOT more refined. This is the type of tea that I imagine being served at Victorian era tea party with little cakes and crumpets. This is going to be a new regular drink for me.
customer_reviews.author: Shaen and Rebecca Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Fancy and tasty teas
customer_reviews.text: I really did like this set of tea. The variety of teas were perfect and I high quality. The green tea was my favorite and the maltiness of the black teas were not over bearing and just perfect. I can definitely see this being a quick gift purchase for family and friends to enjoy. The packaging is definitely a plus, it was easily organized and presented well.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Cho

customer_reviews.title: Finally My Favorite Tea Flavor
customer_reviews.text: Two boxes in, and the consistent, robust flavor continues. I've tried many brands and flavors, and this is my favorite blend of Scottish Breakfast by far. Brewing & steeping small amounts for a short time, and steeping a greater volume for longer both yield tasty, satisfying flavor variations. I don't think it's possible to make a bad cup of tea with this.
customer_reviews.author: Versh

customer_reviews.title: I wasn't impressed.
customer_reviews.text: Listen. I don't know when I became such a tea snob, but this is not my first time feeling compelled to review tea. I had purchased the tea sampler to try out their varieties. Nothing impressed me. The green tea brews dark like a black tea, which I found so strange and unsettling. The chamomile didn't have much of the sweet floral notes that draw me to it as an evening beverage. The Assam was not at all robust as the packaging suggested. Nothing brewed bitter which normally is a good thing, but in this case may have improved these bland teas. Maybe I had a stale batch, but I will be looking elsewhere for my tea samplers.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Such an amazing box of tea! Wish it didnt have non caffeinated teas included, but I'll share those as gifts. ;-) I also wish it has Irish Breakfast tea, but this is a box of English teas. Haha. I'm particularly LOVING the Assam Tea. Picked up the box from my dad's this evening and I've already had 2 cups! It tastes soo good! Thank you! I ended up ordering a box of Assam tea. Hopefully it lasts the month. ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Pug Mom X 2

customer_reviews.title: So/so tea set at a low price
customer_reviews.text: I think this tea box is a great item for someone new to tea, as there are many different varieties you can try out. Compared to other teas i find these more 'malty', less strong, and less flavorfull. You must pull the string out of the tea bags which in my opinion is kind of annoying. Considering the low price and large amount that you get I can't say i tottaly regret the purchase as i will still drink it just in my opinion not as good as other teas.
customer_reviews.author: Chloe

customer_reviews.title: Not like other English Breakfast Tea
customer_reviews.text: The flavor was not at all what I expected. I have several English Breakfast Tea on hand and I drink a few cups daily. Although I can taste a difference between the others, Twinings, Tazo, Great Value (store brand), they were all similar. The Taylors of Harrogate English Breakfast did not taste good to me, did not taste at all like the others and had a tannin flavor.
customer_reviews.author: Do it right the first time

customer_reviews.title: A nice variety sampler
customer_reviews.text: Each packet is perfect to make one large cup or mug of tea, or 2-3 teacups. The flavors give a variety so each day is a nice surprise. I enjoy tea either by the pot into pretty teacups, or one huge mug with honey, and either way they have given me pleasure. I give it only four stars because in order to get the few flavors I really wanted to try, I end up with about three to one that I don't particularly care for.
customer_reviews.author: LindaRuth V.Top Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Good presentation, ok selection of teas
customer_reviews.text: It looks like a high quality box that impresses and has a relatively good selection of teas but I would have preferred more non-caffeinated teas like chamomile and perhaps Green tea. A few of the teas are very distinct and so you will probably end up with some of them as leftovers. Leftovers are a problem if you want to purchase this again. It would be better if they allowed you to customize the tea selection.
customer_reviews.author: Andreas Aristidou

customer_reviews.title: Could use a dash more bergamot, but overall a great tea
customer_reviews.text: This tea is simply divine. When a friend recommended it to me, I had to give it a shot. It's definitely among some of my favorites, and I am becoming somewhat of an Earl Grey connoisseur. I did deduct one star however, because I feel like this tea needs a bit extra bergamot. However, if Taylor's decided to make an extra bergamot version, I'd be in heaven. Even so, this tea is pretty damn good regardless. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: A Man Who Shops

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: Tea bag strings do not hold and tea is very bad. Won’t be purchasing again
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent sleep aid
customer_reviews.text: I'm new to drinking tea, this is the first box of teabags I've ever ordered. I found the taste fairly weak, however, when sweetened and mixed with milk, I really enjoy it. I do believe it works and helps me feel sleepy, although I am not sure if that is a placebo or not. Nonetheless, the tea is helping me as a sleepaid, so I'm giving it five stars
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Lovely Display Poorly Designed Packaging
customer_reviews.text: The tea was alright. The packaging looked really elegant and luxurious, but the packaging is impractical. When I went to open up my tea bags, I found the packets with the tea hard to open. The tea bags are rather delicate. I need to be really careful when I open the packets with tea, carefully tearing around where the tea bag is sealed in. I was surprised at how easy it was to tear into the tea bags by accident. For this reason, I would not repurchase this item again.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Is as described, satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Plain white tea, not overly flavourful or aromatic but has potential for making home made tea combinations or if you just want basic tea. I bought this tea just to try it and see what plain white tea tastes like. I'm just an amateur tea collector but from what I can tell, this brand of white tea is great for exactly what it is.
customer_reviews.author: Big Daddy

customer_reviews.title: Tasty, Relaxing Chamomile
customer_reviews.text: When you've got the flu, live alone, and are out of tea, its Amazon same day delivery to the rescue. I picked this one due to price and availability, but was quite impressed. The box is quite elegant looking, and the tea was fantastic. The taste was much better compared to brands more typically found in US grocery stores.
customer_reviews.author: Shinjaejun

customer_reviews.title: Big name, but needs packaging improvement.
customer_reviews.text: Well as for the packaging I'm not a fan of the little packets. It requires too much energy to rip open having to use both hands instead of just 1 finger like the other tea products offer ( Fold up flap) This also creates more trash to throw away and sometimes that little strip part can fly away under the stove or fridge making it a pain to fetch. Taste was average. Nothing spectacular.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Giftable and delicious
customer_reviews.text: Used at a tea party and guests kept coming back for more. The package was nice enough to just set out for guests to choose for themselves and when there was leftovers I just closed the lid and put it away. I could see gifting this to a small office or a friend who loves a variety of teas or entertaining.
customer_reviews.author: Lynette M

customer_reviews.title: Where’s the Bergamot?
customer_reviews.text: This tea tastes like plain tea instead of Earl Grey. There is only a very tiny hint of Bergamont oil. You could probably pass it off as regular tea and your guests wouldn’t even notice. I purchased Harney & Sons last time, but wanted to try this...never again. I’m going back or trying yet another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Daphne

customer_reviews.text: This makes a very nice gift if you do not have any idea what kind of tea your receiver likes. As for me, it would have been very disappointing because I only like about 50% of the flavors. The other 50% I cannot stand. Mind you, this is a personal thing, but thought maybe others would find it useful.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Steinman

customer_reviews.title: Not Good
customer_reviews.text: This is really bad tea. It has almost no taste except, if you use two bags per cup instead of the recommended one bag, bitterness. If you add honey, the result tastes like honey and almost nothing else!
customer_reviews.author: Cecilia

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift just for no reason
customer_reviews.text: Awesome gift, perfectly priced for just sending as a gift. Great presentation with a broad variety for every taste. English Breakfast, Earl Grey, Decaffeinated Breakfast, Lemon & Orange, Pure Assam, Green Tea with Jasmine, Organic Peppermint, and Organic Chamomile. Variety packs include six tea bags of each variety. Total 48 tea bags included.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Dee Turner, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: A Gift to Myself
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as a gift to myself. I am obsessed with tea and have an entire drawer filled with a variety of teas. I enjoy drinking tea in breaks at work. It makes me feel good. This tea is good quality and I like the packaging as well. Five Stars!
customer_reviews.author: Zoya

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing box dividers-not good for gifting
customer_reviews.text: I thought that this would be a really nice gift idea, but was very disappointed. The box had dividers that were worthless so when I opened the box all the teas were mixed together. Even after I “fixed” the dividers the tea packets moved everywhere.. the tea is great, the selection is very good, but As a gift? Forget about it!
customer_reviews.author: Raven

customer_reviews.title: Delicious!!
customer_reviews.text: I tend to like strong tea, and I never put milk or lemon in, only some sweetener. This tea is amazing! None of the bitterness of English breakfast tea and a bit more punch than just regular black tea. Really nice, smooth flavor. Just don’t steep it for too long, or it’ll get bitter. As the daughter of a packaging engineer I also really love their packaging. The box opens in kind of an interesting way and the texture of the outer teabag packet is lovely. I’m definitely buying this again!
customer_reviews.author: Heather C

customer_reviews.title: Earl Grey lacks flavor
customer_reviews.text: The tea in the box of Taylors of Harrogate tea bags I received lack both black tea and bergamot scent and flavor. The box was properly sealed and the freshness date is July 7, 2021, so the flavor issue can't be blamed on outdated bags. I find I have to use two bags and steep it for a few minutes longer to even come close to the tea experience I have with a single bag of other commercial brands such as Twinings or Bigelow. I will not purchase this brand of tea again..
customer_reviews.author: Whiteviffer

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointed with the flavor
customer_reviews.text: Apple & Cinnamon is not for me. Was expecting a more "celestial seasonings" type of apple flavor where this one is sharper, more ginger like. Brand is great, but this flavor -- no thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Not quite an afternoon beer - but a malty and delicious brew nonetheless.
customer_reviews.text: I am in love with this tea. Colleague introduced it to me, joking that "it's malty. It's like an afternoon beer to get you through the day." I laughed. While it's not really close to a beer it does have a nice malty flavor and the steep provides a rich tea that holds milk well. The foil pouches keep the tea very fresh. When I ran out of these I tried to replace with a grocery store brand Irish Breakfast - it didn't compare. Highly recommend. :)
customer_reviews.author: Teachin'Eng2Kids

customer_reviews.title: 10 star if I can give
customer_reviews.text: I have acid reflux for years and I always avoid taking medications. This tea is the best I drink 1 cup before bed and never ever have heartburn. I can not believe I ate pasta for dinner with sauce and didn't have heartburn that night . Highly recommended if you have acid reflux.
customer_reviews.author: Sera

customer_reviews.title: much weaker than other quality organic teas.
customer_reviews.text: much weaker than other quality organic teas. Good packaging, innovate tea bag with adjustable top string. Good flavor, but weak in comparison to other comparable teas. That's my main reason for giving it 3 stars instead of 4. I used 2 teabags to get the richness I needed from others.
customer_reviews.author: Medicineman

customer_reviews.title: Very Bitter
customer_reviews.text: I realize that different people have different taste buds regarding tea. In my opinion, this is the very worst tea I have ever, ever tasted. It is extremely bitter with no charming tea taste. Nothing could save it, not sugar, not sugar with milk, and of course, not lemon.
customer_reviews.author: Muffin Rockytiger

customer_reviews.title: Spilling Tea
customer_reviews.text: This is great for gifts and for yourself at home. The set up is so clean and organized. Perfect for tea beginners who want to figure out what their preference are or for those who just can’t decide. So much variety and explanation of the type of tea. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: I recently made a trip to London, where I became addicted to the Fortnum and Mason Christmas Tea. Since it was sooo... expensive and seasonal, I thought I would try this one. It is similar enough that it filled my need. I bag will make several cups. Give it a try. You may fall in love.
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: Great tea!
customer_reviews.text: Got this to soak washcloths in to help my little guy as he's teething, and he LOVES IT! He'll sit quietly and suck on the washcloth for 10-20 minutes at a time. We make sure there's always a batch in the fridge now, and I love that it's organic. Might start making a cup for me before bed!
customer_reviews.author: FabulousJen

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised with this tasting assortment. The teas are nicely packaged, and gives a variety of options to try. My only constructive criticism would be that the peppermint has a strange aftertaste when compared with other peppermint teas, and the citrus blend is a bit too acidic. That being said, I would still purchase again because the other options are delicious!
customer_reviews.author: Scott Lester

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great
customer_reviews.text: i usually am fond of twininng jasmine green tea, in the morning to get some caffeine intake, i decided to explore to see what taylors of harrogate has to offer. it doesnt have as strong of jasmine taste as twining tea, but its okay. if you like a tea that has strong smell of jasmine. i would suggest trying out prince of peace organic jasmine green tea.i havent found anything that come close to it.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan's Experience ☺️Top Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Great Mother's Day gift
customer_reviews.text: This tea sample set made a great Mother's Day gift and I would recommend it to anyone that enjoys tea or needs a gift for any occasion! My mom said the tea is strong, so she likes that she doesn't need much to enjoy it. I liked how this set had 48 tea bags, too.
customer_reviews.author: kconn88

customer_reviews.title: The Best Bagged Chamomile On The Market!
customer_reviews.text: As a major tea drinker, I have tried various brands of Chamomile, but none have compared to Taylors of Harrogate! While this is a bagged tea (and I prefer loose leaf tea) for a bagged tea I'd say it's one of the best I have ever tasted. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Jane Austen

customer_reviews.title: where's the bergamot???
customer_reviews.text: I was so looking forward to making a brisk iced tea using this brand of Earl Grey. What a disappointment!! The taste was on the bitter side and I tasted little to no bergamot, which is the ingredient that MAKES earl grey. Oh well, won't buy again and definitely don't recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Snoop

customer_reviews.title: We used one for the "tea table" and everyone found one they liked and enjoyed them
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for a Bridal Tea Party. We used one for the "tea table" and everyone found one they liked and enjoyed them! They are packages beautifully which makes it easy to see the different flavors. I liked that they have both regular and decaf. The other we used as a prize for one of the games and the winner was very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: No taste
customer_reviews.text: This box of teas makes a nice gift because it's packaged well. Unfortunately I thought the teas were a bit bland and no better than cheaper supermarket brands. Actually I prefer my supermarket chamomile tea better than this one. The peppermint was ok.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: decent quality jasmine green tea
customer_reviews.text: I am satisfied with this tea. 4 stars not 5 because I like strong flavors, in general, and this tea could have more flavor. I use 2 sachets instead of 1. Also, I do not like how you have to pull the string out on the sachets. What is the point of that?
customer_reviews.author: Harold Finch

customer_reviews.title: Not my cup of tea
customer_reviews.text: Looks good on the outside but the flavor is not strong at all.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna

customer_reviews.title: Ok taste. Damaged box. Buy again and hope arrive undamaged.
customer_reviews.text: Box was completely crushed inside (shipping box unharmed). Thankfully individually wrapped so no broken tea leaves. Taste ok, but could be stronger. Trying different brewing options. Yes, tea is good to taste, but prefer a little stronger (may just need to try loose tea version).
customer_reviews.author: Sophist

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended, low quality.
customer_reviews.text: I do not recommend this tea selection. I have been making and enjoying tea for over 50 years but I would not purchase this again. Even after perfectly heated water and timed steeping all the flavors (6) I tried from this box tasted weak and watery.
customer_reviews.author: Northridge Gardener

customer_reviews.title: Ideal for buffet
customer_reviews.text: I belong to several organizations that have meetings that end with refreshments, a meal, or a snack. This box with its variety of teas is ideal. It is light weight when you have a lot to carry, offers a good variety of teas and looks very nice.
customer_reviews.author: LeDon Young

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful (& delicious) teas - 5 caffeinated, 3 decaf
customer_reviews.text: First of all, the packaging is really beautiful. Comes in a sturdy cardboard box and looks nice enough that you could leave it out on the counter. The inside of the box's lid has information about the company if you're interested in a quick read while your tea steeps. Each tea bag is individually wrapped and has instructions on how long to brew it. The English Breakfast, Pure Assam, and Earl Grey are all very delicious (as that is all I have tried, so far). 5 teas are caffeinated while the other 3 are decaf. If you're looking for a nice variety of tea to serve at parties, the office, or your favorite house guests, this is highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: salty.spitoon.executive

customer_reviews.title: Sooooooooooo yummmmm!!! 🌟💗👍🏻☕️🧘‍♂️
customer_reviews.text: This green tea is TRÈS delicious!!! I love that it has a lighter fresh jasmine flavor and scent as opposed to an overwhelming aroma and cheap taste, which is all I can seem to find when I buy a jasmine green tea from a grocery store shelf. It is PERFECT, exactly how I was hoping it would be! So glad I found this, I will def be purchasing this again! 💝
customer_reviews.author: R.A. Day

customer_reviews.title: Very nice tea!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the English Breakfast tea bags and they just arrived today - a cold wintery day by me - and I couldn't wait to make a cup of tea this afternoon. These are very good tea bags and the flavor is strong enough for my taste, something I haven't been able to get from my k-cups for the Keurig brewer. I let the bag steep for about 4 minutes and it was perfect. This is my first time trying this brand and I would definitely recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: E. R.Top Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Great, strong teas packed with flavor
customer_reviews.text: These are some of the best teas I've had. My particular favorites are the Earl Grey (and I've had earl greys by other brands that I did not like), Assam, and Peppermint. The green tea with jasmine has a nice floral-like hint of flavor and the lemon and orange is good with some honey, especially to soothe a sore throat or just as a nice fruity tea, particularly in the summer.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Sugar and cream---great tea.
customer_reviews.text: I drink A LOT of tea and this is the best Earl Grey that I have tried. The flavor is excellent and rich, also the flavor shines with cream added. Great in the evening but also brew longer for the morning ( stronger). I use a tad of sugar and cream!! When I purchased this I did so on Subscribe and Save and the price was great ( though they tend to change on here ). I do recommend if you like Earl Grey that you give this one a try.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Coleman

product_meta.title: Taylors of Harrogate Classic Tea Variety Box, 48 Count (Pack of 1)
product_meta.description: Style:Teabags| Flavor Name:Classic Tea Variety Box| Size:48 Count (Pack of 1)Our Taylors Tea Variety Box is perfect for gifting, businesses, home, office, or to simply try and find your favorite tea flavor
feature_bullets: Varieties included: English Breakfast, Earl Grey, Decaffeinated Breakfast, Lemon & Orange, Pure Assam, Green Tea with Jasmine, Organic Peppermint, and Organic Chamomile. Variety packs include six tea bags of each variety. Total 48 tea bags included. From black and green teas to Earl Grey and fusion teas, there's something in the line-up for every tea fan to savor. Each variety can be enjoyed as a standalone beverage, but many pair up nicely with biscuits and other sweets.
Variety packs include six tea bags of each variety.

We’re an independent family tea and coffee company from Harrogate in Yorkshire. We have strong family values, like a love for fairness, quality, creativity and the importance of treating people with respect. And we're completely, utterly devoted to the pursuit of extraordinary flavour.
Variety packs include six tea bags of each variety.

specifications.Manufacturer: Brands of Britain, LLC - Taylors of Harrogate
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
